name: change_alarm_state
description: Changes the state of specific alarms based on provided filters, or performs a bulk state change on all alarms.

alarm_ids.description: A list of string identifiers for the specific alarms whose state will be changed.

alarm_type.description: The type of the alarm to be modified.

time_of_day.description: Time of the day of the alarm in strict HH:MM:SS format (e.g., '13:30:00', '01:00:00').

am_pm_or_unknown.description: Specifies the meridiem for the alarm's time. The value must be one of the following strings: `AM`, `PM`, or `UNKNOWN`.

label.description: The label used to identify the specific alarm to modify.

state_operation.description: The operation to perform on the alarm's state.

date.description: The specific date used to filter and select an alarm for modification.

start_date.description: A filter that includes alarms scheduled to fire on or after the specified date.

end_date.description: A filter that selects alarms scheduled to fire on or before this specified date, acting as the inclusive end of the date range.

bulk_operation.description: Indicates whether to perform the operation as a bulk action on all alarms.

name: change_timer_state
description: Modifies the state of one or more timers. Supported state operations include resume, pause, reset, cancel, delete, stop, and dismiss.

timer_ids.description: A list of string identifiers for the timers that should be modified.

timer_type.description: The type of timer to be modified. The value must be either `UPCOMING`, `PAUSED`, or `RUNNING`.

duration.description: A filter to select timers for modification based on their duration.

label.description: The label used to select a specific timer for modification.

state_operation.description: Specifies the action to perform on the timer, such as `resume`, `pause`, `reset`, `cancel`, `delete`, `stop`, or `dismiss`.

bulk_operation.description: A boolean that, when `True`, applies the operation to all timers, ignoring any other filtering parameters.

name: create_alarm
description: Creates a new alarm, which can be set for a specific duration (e.g., 15 minutes) or scheduled for a particular time of day (e.g., 10:30am).

duration.description: Duration of the alarm. Format: "<hours>h<minutes>m<seconds>s", e.g., "5h30m20s", "10m", "2m15s", "5h", or "45s". Any combination of these units is allowed, but the total duration must be greater than 0 seconds.

time.description: The time of day for the alarm to fire, specified in 12-hour format as `H[:M[:S]]` (e.g., "11:20").

date.description: The scheduled date for the alarm, which must be formatted as a `YYYY-MM-DD` string.

label.description: A descriptive text label used to identify the alarm.

recurrence.description: A list of one or more days for the alarm to recur. Values must be uppercase strings, such as `SUNDAY`, `MONDAY`, or `TUESDAY`.

name: create_clock
description: Creates a clock object that functions as either a timer or an alarm.

type.description: Specifies the type of clock component to create. The value must be either `TIMER` or `ALARM`.

duration.description: Duration of the timer or alarm. Format: "<hours>h<minutes>m<seconds>s", e.g., "5h30m20s", "10m", "2m15s", "5h", or "45s". Any combination of these units is allowed, but the total duration must be greater than 0 seconds.

time_of_day.description: Time of the day in strict HH:MM:SS format (e.g., '13:30:00', '01:00:00').

am_pm_or_unknown.description: Specifies the meridiem for the alarm time. Must be one of the following string values: `AM`, `PM`, or `UNKNOWN`.

date.description: The scheduled date, which must be a string in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

label.description: A descriptive name for the timer or alarm.

recurrence.description: A list of strings that defines the recurrence pattern for the alarm.

name: create_timer
description: Creates a new timer that fires after a specified duration (e.g., "10m") or at a specific time of day (e.g., "10:30").

duration.description: Duration of the timer. Format: "<hours>h<minutes>m<seconds>s", e.g., "5h30m20s", "10m", "2m15s", "5h", or "45s". Any combination of these units is allowed, but the total duration must be greater than 0 seconds.

time.description: The time of day the timer should activate, formatted as a string in 12-hour format (e.g., "H:M:S"). Hours are required, while minutes and seconds are optional.

label.description: An optional string that provides a descriptive name for the timer.

name: modify_alarm
description: Modifies properties of one or more existing alarms, such as their time, label, date, or recurrence pattern. Alarms can be selected using a query, their ID, or modified all at once.

query.description: The time of day or label that identifies the specific alarm to modify.

alarm_type.description: Filters the operation to only affect alarms of a specific type.

new_time_of_day.description: The new time of the day in strict HH:MM:SS format (e.g., '13:30:00', '01:00:00').

new_am_pm_or_unknown.description: Specifies the new period for the alarm's time of day. The value must be one of "AM", "PM", or "UNKNOWN".

new_label.description: The new label that replaces the alarm's existing label.

alarm_ids.description: A list of unique string identifiers specifying which alarms to modify.

duration_to_add.description: Specifies the duration to add to the alarm's scheduled time.

date.description: The date of the alarm that should be modified. This parameter filters for the specific alarm instance to update.

new_date.description: Specifies the new date for the alarm.

new_recurrence.description: A list of strings that defines the new recurrence pattern for the alarm.

bulk_operation.description: A boolean flag that, if `True`, applies the modification to all alarms.

name: modify_alarm_v2
description: Modifies the label, time, or state for a single alarm or for multiple alarms in a bulk operation.

filters.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs that specifies the criteria for selecting which alarms to modify. Each key represents an alarm attribute, and the corresponding value is used for matching.

modifications.description: A dictionary of the properties to update on the target alarms. Supported keys include 'time', 'date' (as 'YYYY-MM-DD'), 'label', 'duration_to_add', 'recurrence' (e.g., `['MONDAY', 'FRIDAY']`), and 'state_operation' (e.g., 'ENABLE', 'DELETE').

bulk_operation.description: A flag that must be set to `true` to confirm and permit the modification of multiple alarms at once. This prevents accidental changes when filters match more than one alarm.

name: modify_timer
description: Modifies the duration or label for one or more timers. This includes setting a new duration, adding time to the current duration, or assigning a new label.

query.description: The duration or label used to identify the timer to be modified.

timer_type.description: The state of the timer to filter by. The value must be `UPCOMING`, `PAUSED`, or `RUNNING`.

new_duration.description: The new duration to set for the timer, which replaces its existing duration.

duration_to_add.description: Specifies a duration to add to the timer's current time.

new_label.description: Specifies the new label to apply to the timer(s) being modified.

timer_ids.description: A list of unique string identifiers for the timers to be modified.

bulk_operation.description: A boolean that, if set to `True`, applies the modification as a bulk operation to all existing timers.

name: modify_timer_v2
description: Modifies the label, duration, or state of one or more timers.

filters.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs used to select the timers for modification. Keys represent timer attributes, and their corresponding values are the criteria to match.

modifications.description: A dictionary of modifications to apply to the timer. Supported keys include `label`, `duration`, `duration_to_add`, and `state_operation` (e.g., 'PAUSE', 'RESUME', 'DELETE').

bulk_operation.description: A flag that must be set to `True` to apply modifications to all timers matching the `filters` when more than one is found.

name: show_matching_alarms
description: Retrieves alarms that match specified filter criteria. Filters can be applied based on a query, alarm type, IDs, a specific date, or a date range.

query.description: A search filter for an alarm, which can be either the alarm's exact time or its text label.

alarm_type.description: The type of alarm to show. It must be one of the following values: `UPCOMING`, `DISABLED`, or `ACTIVE`.

alarm_ids.description: A list of alarm identifiers to filter results. Only alarms with an ID matching one in this list will be shown.

date.description: Filters alarms for a specific date. The date must be a string formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.

start_date.description: The inclusive start date for filtering alarms. Only alarms scheduled on or after this date are returned, and the date must be a string in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The end date for the search range, formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`. This filter includes alarms scheduled to fire on or before the specified date.

name: show_matching_timers
description: Finds and returns timers that match specified criteria. Timers can be filtered by a query (duration, time of day, or label), type (`UPCOMING`, `PAUSED`, `RUNNING`), or a list of IDs.

query.description: A search query for finding a timer, which can be its duration, time of day, or label.

timer_type.description: The state to filter timers by, which must be one of `UPCOMING`, `PAUSED`, or `RUNNING`.

timer_ids.description: A list of unique identifiers used to select specific timers for display.

name: show_stopwatch
description: Displays the current state of the stopwatch.

name: snooze
description: Snoozes any currently firing alarm, either for a specified duration in seconds or until a particular time. If neither is provided, the alarm is snoozed for 600 seconds.

time.description: The snooze end time, specified as a string in the 12-hour format "H[:M[:S]]".

duration.description: The number of seconds for which to snooze the alarm.

name: snooze_alarm
description: Snoozes a fired alarm, either for a specified duration in seconds or until a specific time of day.

snooze_duration.description: A string representing the duration in seconds to snooze the alarm.

snooze_till_time_of_day.description: The time of day to snooze the alarm until in strict HH:MM:SS format (e.g., '13:30:00', '01:00:00').

am_pm_or_unknown.description: The period of the day for `snooze_till_time_of_day`. The value must be one of the following strings: "AM", "PM", or "UNKNOWN".

name: start_stopwatch
description: Starts a stopped stopwatch or resumes one that is paused.
